item.description:
The East Bay Bike path is a 14.5 mile, 10 foot wide, ribbon of asphalt that provides a safe place for unobstructed cycling. Users can enjoy the sights, sounds and smells as the path takes them by coves and marshes, over bridges, and through State Parks.

Providence - Bristol, RI

info: http://riparks.com/Locations/LocationEastBay.html

info: http://www.dot.ri.gov/bikeri/east_bay_bike_path.asp

map: http://www.dot.ri.gov/img/content/bikeri/maps/ebbp2013.jpg

Directions:  Route 95 south toward Providence to Route 195 East, take Exit #4 / the exit forks, stay Right Riverside / follow Veterans Memorial Parkway and you will see a Large Parking Lot on the Right. ** There are 2 parking lots on the pkwy each about a 1/4 ml away from each other**...get there as early as you can because RIDOT has closed down the bike path along the bridge so RI commuters will probably use these parking lots as well to get on the path.
item.name: East Bay Bike Path, RI
